column1: Guaxupé is a Brazilian municipality located in the southwest of the state of Minas Gerais. Its estimated population in 2017 was 52.294 inhabitants living in a total area of 286 km². The city belongs to the meso-region of Sul e Sudoeste de Minas and to the micro-region of São Sebastião do Paraíso.  It became a municipality in 1837.
== Location ==
The city center of Guaxupé is located at an elevation of 760 meters a short distance from the state boundary of São Paulo.  Neighboring  municipalities are:  Pratinha and  São Pedro da União (N)

column1: == Health and Education ==
In the health sector there were 13 health clinics  and 1 private hospital with 100 beds (2005).  Educational needs of 11

Life expectancy: 73 (average of males and females)In 2000 the per capita monthly income of R$301.00 was above the state average of R$276.00 and above the national average of R$297.00.  Poços de Caldas had the highest per capita monthly income in 2000 with R$435.00.  The lowest was Setubinha with R$73.00.

column1: == Historical Heritage ==
Palácio das Águias - The Eagles Palace was inventoried in 2007 by the CDMPHC.;
Prédio da Academia de Comércio São José - Property still listed by the Municipal Decree no. 1
Antiga Loja Jacob Miguel Sabbag e Cia Ltda - (current Guaxupé Farm Administration Agency- SEF / MG) - Real estate listed by Municipal Decree no. 1
Antiga Cadeia Pública Estadual - Former State Public Jail - Property still listed by the Municipal Decree no. 973
Antiga Câmara Municipal - Old Town Hall (current Comendador Sebastião de Sá Historical and Geographic Museum) - Real estate listed by Municipal Decree no. 974

Conjunto Arquitetônico e Paisagístico da Antiga Estação Ferroviária de Guaxupé - Architectural and Scenic Set of the Old Guaxupé Railway Station (FEPASA / Mogiana Municipal Park) - Real estate property listed by Municipal Decree no. 856 of July 29
Palácio da Justiça - Palace of justice (former Forum of the District and current City Hall of Guaxupé) - Real estate listed by the Municipal Decree no. 972
Antigo Hotel Cobra - (current Arlete Souza Mendes Municipal Theater) - Real estate property listed by Municipal Decree no. 975 of April 4
Antiga Agência do Banco do Brasil - Former Bank of Brazil Branch (current City Hall) - Real estate listed by the Municipal Decree no. 860 of September 29
Herma Cel. Antônio Costa Monteiro - Property still listed by the Municipal Decree no. 1
Monumento ao Trabalhador Rural - O “Nicanor” - Rural Worker Monument - The “Nicanor” - Immovable property listed by Municipal Decree no. 1
Obelisco em Homenagem ao Expedicionário Guaxupeano da FEB - Obelisk Honoring FEB Guaxupean Expeditionary - Property still listed by the Municipal Decree no. 1
Catedral de Nossa Senhora das Dores - Property still listed by the Municipal Decree no. 1

Casa de Pau-a-pique (antiga sede da Fazenda Bom Jardim dos Machados) - Pau-a-pique House (former headquarters of the Bom Jardim dos Machados Farm) - Property still listed by the Municipal Decree no. 1272
Taça de 1928 – “PRIMEIRO JOGO INTERNACIONAL REALIZADO EM MINAS” - 1928 Cup - “FIRST INTERNATIONAL GAME HELD IN MINAS” - Mobile well overturned by Municipal Decree no. 855 of July 29
Imaginária de São Miguel Arcanjo - Property overturned by Municipal Decree no. 1
